doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia

Greek Revival Style--Judge Thomas Barton Lyons Home 1891-1927--A G Carter Home 1927--Doorway similar to Tower Hse & Word-Wertenbaker House--Allegedly 1st house in Charlottesville to have indoor plumbing with 4000 gal attic tank--Door key from Monticello in house--Named after the ship to bring the 1st Jefferson (John) to America in 1619

2 Story Brick, Metal Ionic Columns, 3 Bay, 2 Pile, Pilasters, 5 Course American with Flemish Bond, Brick Painted Red, High Cellar, Hipped Roof, Widows Walk, Internal Chimneys, Rectangular Banisters, Circular Saw Marks, Transom with Sidelights, Brackets, Water Tank in Attic, Porch, Symmetrical Trim, Rondel Blocks, 4 Panel Doors, Tripartite Windows, Dual Windows, 4/4, Had Jib Windows, Pyramidal Roofed Frame SmokehouseBrick Carriage House (Was Slave Qtrs):Tetrastyle Portico, Stepped Gables, Modillion Cornice, Arched Carriage Doorway, 6/6, 3 Bay, Mortar Chimney Cap inscribed DMT 1832 Barn Foundation: End of Park Lane
survey data: Architecture in Virginia --Charlottesville's Historic Landmarks Study Surveys
